leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 环境-污染/生态建模与监测生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 采集→清洗→预测/告警→解释→报告
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 时序库 + 监控 + 可视化

queries: [WEB] time series causal discovery tools github

tools.name: CEVAE
tools.one_line_profile: Deep latent-variable model for causal effect inference
tools.detailed_description: A TensorFlow implementation of the Causal Effect Variational Autoencoder (CEVAE), designed to estimate causal effects from observational data by leveraging deep latent-variable models to adjust for confounding.

tools.name: CATENets
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network-based estimators for Conditional Average Treatment Effects
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing Scikit-learn compatible implementations of various neural network-based methods for estimating Conditional Average Treatment Effects (CATE), including S-Learner, T-Learner, TARNet, and DragonNet.

tools.name: causallib
tools.one_line_profile: Modular causal inference analysis and model evaluation tool
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for causal inference, providing a modular API for estimating treatment effects using various statistical and machine learning models, along with tools for model evaluation and validation.

tools.name: pycirk
tools.one_line_profile: Modeling Circular Economy policy interventions in Input-Output Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to model Circular Economy policy and technological interventions within Environmentally Extended Input-Output Analysis (EEIOA), specifically tailored for use with mrSUTs (EXIOBASE).

tools.name: CausalRivers
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark package for causal discovery on river data
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark package and dataset for evaluating causal discovery methods using real-world time series data from river networks, facilitating the comparison of algorithms in environmental science contexts.

tools.name: VLTimeSeriesCausality
tools.one_line_profile: Variable-lag Granger causality and transfer entropy inference
tools.detailed_description: A framework for inferring causality between pairs of time series using Variable-lag Granger causality and transfer entropy, suitable for analyzing temporal dependencies in complex systems.

tools.name: YLearn
tools.one_line_profile: All-in-one causal learning and inference package
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for causal inference that supports various aspects of the causal learning process, including causal discovery, treatment effect estimation, and policy evaluation.

tools.name: DoubleML-Python
tools.one_line_profile: Double Machine Learning framework in Python
tools.detailed_description: The Python implementation of the Double Machine Learning framework, enabling the estimation of causal effects using machine learning methods while accounting for high-dimensional nuisance parameters.

tools.name: DoubleML-R
tools.one_line_profile: Double Machine Learning framework in R
tools.detailed_description: The R implementation of the Double Machine Learning framework, providing tools for causal inference and treatment effect estimation using machine learning techniques.

tools.name: DoubleML-Serverless
tools.one_line_profile: Serverless architecture extension for distributed Double Machine Learning
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the DoubleML library that enables distributed Double Machine Learning calculations using a serverless architecture, facilitating scalable causal inference.

tools.name: CausalDiscoveryToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive Python package for causal inference and graph structure recovery
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for causal inference in graphs and pairwise settings, including tools for graph structure recovery and dependency analysis.

tools.name: GenomicSEM
tools.one_line_profile: Structural equation modeling tool for GWAS summary statistics
tools.detailed_description: An R package for structural equation modeling based on GWAS summary data, allowing for the analysis of multivariate genetic architecture.

tools.name: Causality Lab
tools.one_line_profile: Causal discovery algorithms and experimentation platform
tools.detailed_description: A collection of causal discovery algorithms and tools for implementing and benchmarking new ones, developed by Intel Labs.

tools.name: dsem
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic structural equation models for spatial and temporal data
tools.detailed_description: An R package for fitting dynamic structural equation models, particularly useful for spatial and temporal data analysis in ecology and environmental science.

tools.name: Associations.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia algorithms for associations, independence testing, and causal inference
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing algorithms for quantifying associations, performing independence tests, and conducting causal inference from data.

tools.name: CSLE
tools.one_line_profile: Cyber Security Learning Environment for developing automated security policies
tools.detailed_description: A research platform to develop automated security policies using quantitative methods such as reinforcement learning, game theory, and causal inference.

tools.name: TCDF
tools.one_line_profile: Temporal Causal Discovery Framework for discovering causal relationships in time series
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based framework for discovering causal relationships between time series data, utilizing attention-based convolutional neural networks.

tools.name: CATEs
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning estimation of heterogeneous causal effects
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing methods for the machine learning estimation of heterogeneous causal effects (CATEs).

tools.name: causalDML
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of Double Machine Learning for causal inference
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing Double Machine Learning methods for causal inference, facilitating robust estimation of causal effects.

tools.name: dmlmt
tools.one_line_profile: R package for Double Machine Learning with Multiple Treatments
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing Double Machine Learning (DML) methods specifically designed for scenarios involving multiple treatments. It facilitates causal inference by combining machine learning predictive models with econometric techniques to estimate treatment effects.

tools.name: cause2e
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end causal analysis pipeline in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the entire causal analysis workflow, from causal discovery to effect estimation. It provides a high-level interface for performing end-to-end causal inference on datasets.

tools.name: sherlock
tools.one_line_profile: Causal machine learning for segment discovery
tools.detailed_description: An R package developed by Netflix for causal machine learning, specifically focused on segment discovery and analysis to identify heterogeneous treatment effects.

tools.name: ucate
tools.one_line_profile: Uncertainty in Conditional Average Treatment Effect Estimation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for estimating uncertainty in Conditional Average Treatment Effect (CATE) predictions, developed by the Oxford Applied and Theoretical Machine Learning Group.

tools.name: RiskStratifiedEstimation
tools.one_line_profile: Risk-stratified treatment effect estimation
tools.detailed_description: An R package from OHDSI for evaluating treatment effect heterogeneity using a risk-based approach, allowing for the assessment of how treatment effects vary across different risk strata.

tools.name: OpenASCE
tools.one_line_profile: Open All-Scale Causal Engine for large-scale causal learning
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for end-to-end large-scale causal learning, providing algorithms for causal discovery, causal effect estimation, and attribution.

tools.name: OpenMx
tools.one_line_profile: Extended Structural Equation Modeling
tools.detailed_description: A powerful and flexible R package for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM), allowing for the specification, estimation, and analysis of a wide variety of statistical models.

tools.name: SyntheticControlMethods
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference using Synthetic Control Methods
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing Synthetic Control Methods for causal inference, useful for estimating the effect of interventions in comparative case studies.

tools.name: bicycle
tools.one_line_profile: Intervention-Based Causal Discovery with Cycles
tools.detailed_description: A library for causal discovery that can handle cyclic graphs using intervention data, useful for biological and complex system modeling.

tools.name: CImpact
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference library for time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by Sanofi for performing causal inference on time series data, enabling the assessment of interventions in temporal datasets.

tools.name: StructuralEquationModels.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and flexible Structural Equation Modelling in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) that emphasizes performance and flexibility, allowing for the definition and estimation of complex latent variable models.

tools.name: fast-causal-inference
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance causal inference computing library based on OLAP
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance causal inference (statistical model) computing library based on OLAP, designed to solve performance bottlenecks of existing statistical model libraries (R/Python) under big data scenarios.

tools.name: Granger-causality
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient implementation of Granger causality and its extensions
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing efficient implementations of Granger causality and its extensions, developed by the USC Melady Lab.

tools.name: nlpsem
tools.one_line_profile: R package for analyzing nonlinear longitudinal processes in SEM
tools.detailed_description: An R package for analyzing nonlinear longitudinal processes within the structural equation modeling (SEM) framework, suitable for complex causal modeling.

tools.name: pyGC
tools.one_line_profile: Granger Causality library in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library dedicated to performing Granger Causality tests on time series data.

tools.name: tfcausalimpact
tools.one_line_profile: Python Causal Impact Implementation using TensorFlow Probability
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Google's Causal Impact algorithm (originally in R), built using TensorFlow Probability for estimating causal effects of interventions on time series.

tools.name: mlcausality
tools.one_line_profile: Nonlinear Granger causality using machine learning techniques
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for estimating nonlinear Granger causality using machine learning techniques, such as Kernel Ridge Regression.

tools.name: PyCausality
tools.one_line_profile: Predictive causality between time series using information-theoretic techniques
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to calculate predictive causality between time series using information-theoretic techniques like Transfer Entropy.

tools.name: psmpy
tools.one_line_profile: Propensity score matching in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for propensity score matching (PSM), facilitating causal inference by balancing covariates in observational data.

tools.name: causalnlp
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for causal inference with text
tools.detailed_description: A practical toolkit for causal inference where text is used as a treatment, outcome, or controlled-for variable.

tools.name: causeinfer
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning based causal inference/uplift in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for machine learning-based causal inference and uplift modeling, providing standard algorithms for treatment effect estimation.

tools.name: causalDisco
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for causal discovery in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing tools and algorithms for causal discovery from data.

tools.name: causalforge
tools.one_line_profile: Suite of modeling & causal inference methods
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing a suite of modeling and causal inference methods using machine learning algorithms, developed by Anthem AI (Elevance Health).

tools.name: asympPDC
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB package for Partial Directed Coherence (PDC) estimation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB and Octave package for Partial Directed Coherence (PDC) and Directed Transfer Function (DTF) estimation with asymptotic statistics, used for Granger Causality analysis.

tools.name: linearmodels
tools.one_line_profile: Linear models including instrumental variable and panel data models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that extends statsmodels with additional linear models, specifically focusing on instrumental variable (IV) models and panel data models for econometrics and causal inference.

tools.name: kmatch
tools.one_line_profile: Stata module for multivariate-distance and propensity-score matching
tools.detailed_description: A Stata package implementing various matching methods for causal inference, including multivariate-distance matching, propensity-score matching, entropy balancing, and inverse probability weighting.

tools.name: drtmle
tools.one_line_profile: Doubly-robust nonparametric estimators for average treatment effects
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides nonparametric estimators of the average treatment effect with doubly-robust confidence intervals and hypothesis tests, utilizing targeted minimum loss-based estimation (TMLE).

tools.name: DeepSCM
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Structural Causal Models for counterfactual inference
tools.detailed_description: A framework for Deep Structural Causal Models (DeepSCM) that enables tractable counterfactual inference by combining deep learning with structural causal models, particularly for medical imaging and other high-dimensional data.

tools.name: causal-text-embeddings
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference using text embeddings
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit for performing causal inference on text data by leveraging text embeddings to adjust for confounding variables found in natural language.

tools.name: Onyx
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical interface for Structural Equation Modeling
tools.detailed_description: A standalone software application for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) that provides a graphical user interface for model specification, estimation, and visualization.

tools.name: semtree
tools.one_line_profile: Recursive partitioning for Structural Equation Models
tools.detailed_description: An R package that implements recursive partitioning (trees and forests) for Structural Equation Models (SEM) to detect heterogeneity in model parameters.

tools.name: CausalMatch
tools.one_line_profile: Automated decision-making via causal inference and machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A research project and toolkit integrating machine learning and econometrics methods (specifically matching and causal inference) to automate decision-making processes.

tools.name: causy
tools.one_line_profile: User-friendly causal discovery library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to make causal discovery algorithms accessible and easy to use, supporting various methods for inferring causal structures from data.

tools.name: lingam
tools.one_line_profile: Causal discovery using Linear Non-Gaussian Acyclic Models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing LiNGAM (Linear Non-Gaussian Acyclic Model) algorithms for causal discovery, allowing estimation of causal structures from observational data.

tools.name: defuse
tools.one_line_profile: Nonlinear causal discovery with confounders
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for nonlinear causal discovery in the presence of latent confounders, implementing the Deconfounding via Unsupervised Learning (DEFUSE) method.

tools.name: causal_discovery_for_time_series
tools.one_line_profile: Library for causal discovery in time series data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of algorithms and tools for performing causal discovery specifically on time series data, including implementations and wrappers for various methods like PCMCI and Granger causality.

tools.name: CausalGPS
tools.one_line_profile: Matching on Generalized Propensity Scores with Continuous Exposures
tools.detailed_description: An R package for causal inference with continuous treatments, implementing matching on generalized propensity scores (GPS) to adjust for confounding.

tools.name: Matching
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate and Propensity Score Matching with Balance Optimization
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing functions for multivariate and propensity score matching, including genetic search algorithms to find optimal balance.

tools.name: cxplain
tools.one_line_profile: Causal explanations for machine learning models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for explaining the predictions of machine learning models using causal reasoning, providing insights into feature importance and causal drivers of model outputs.

tools.name: KernelGrangerCausality
tools.one_line_profile: Nonlinear Granger causality using kernel methods
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolkit for evaluating nonlinear Granger causality using the kernel trick, allowing for the detection of complex causal relationships in time series data.

tools.name: market-impact-renewables
tools.one_line_profile: Double Machine Learning toolkit for Energy Analytics
tools.detailed_description: An applied machine learning toolkit implementing Double Machine Learning (DML) specifically tailored for energy analytics and market impact analysis of renewables.

tools.name: drug2ways
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for analyzing causal paths on multiscale networks for drug discovery
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for drug discovery that analyzes causal paths within multiscale networks. It implements algorithms to traverse and reason over biological knowledge graphs to identify potential drug mechanisms.

tools.name: blavaan
tools.one_line_profile: R package for Bayesian structural equation modeling
tools.detailed_description: An R package that fits Bayesian structural equation models (SEMs). It builds on the 'lavaan' package syntax and features, utilizing JAGS or Stan for MCMC sampling to estimate posterior distributions.

tools.name: causalgraphs_latex
tools.one_line_profile: LaTeX package for drawing causal graphical models
tools.detailed_description: A LaTeX toolset for creating high-quality visualizations of causal graphs (DAGs), essential for scientific communication in causal inference research.

tools.name: bnlearn
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for causal discovery and Bayesian network learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for learning the graphical structure of Bayesian networks, parameter learning, inference, and sampling. It supports causal discovery tasks essential for modeling complex environmental and ecological systems.

tools.name: benchpress
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable framework for benchmarking causal discovery algorithms
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software framework designed to run, develop, and benchmark causal discovery algorithms efficiently. It facilitates the evaluation of causal inference methods on various datasets.

tools.name: SEMgraph
tools.one_line_profile: R package for causal network analysis via Structural Equation Modeling
tools.detailed_description: An R package that integrates network analysis with Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) to perform causal structure learning and inference on complex systems.

tools.name: BCEA
tools.one_line_profile: R package for Bayesian Cost Effectiveness Analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package for performing health economic evaluations using Bayesian models. It processes results from MCMC simulations to analyze costs and clinical benefits, producing summary statistics and plots for decision analysis.

tools.name: CausalImpact
tools.one_line_profile: R package for causal inference in time series
tools.detailed_description: An R package developed by Google for estimating the causal effect of a designed intervention on a time series. It uses a Bayesian structural time-series model to predict the counterfactual outcome.

tools.name: MVGC (Python)
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate Granger Causality analysis tool for time series data
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Multivariate Granger Causality (MVGC) toolbox, originally developed in MATLAB. It provides functions for calculating Granger causality in multivariate time series, useful for analyzing causal interactions in complex systems.

tools.name: GVAR
tools.one_line_profile: Interpretable framework for nonlinear multivariate Granger causality inference
tools.detailed_description: GVAR is a framework designed to infer nonlinear multivariate Granger causality using self-explaining neural networks. It aims to provide interpretable causal discovery in complex systems.

tools.name: Neural-GC
tools.one_line_profile: Granger causality discovery using neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing Granger causality discovery on time series data using neural network-based models. It supports capturing nonlinear causal relationships in high-dimensional data.

tools.name: pypsy
tools.one_line_profile: Psychometrics and Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) package
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for psychometrics including Item Response Theory (IRT), Computerized Adaptive Testing (CAT), and Structural Equation Modeling (SEM). While focused on psychometrics, its SEM capabilities are applicable to causal modeling in other scientific domains.

tools.name: Tigramite
tools.one_line_profile: Time series causal inference library
tools.detailed_description: Tigramite is a Python package for causal inference with a focus on time series data. It implements methods like PCMCI for discovering causal graphical models from observational time series, handling time delays and autocorrelation.

tools.name: piecewiseSEM
tools.one_line_profile: Piecewise Structural Equation Modeling in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package for fitting piecewise structural equation models (SEM). It allows for the analysis of causal networks in ecological and other complex systems, supporting generalized linear models and mixed-effects models within the SEM framework.

tools.name: ges
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of the GES causal discovery algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Greedy Equivalence Search (GES) algorithm for causal discovery. It identifies the equivalence class of Bayesian networks that best explain the data.

tools.name: sempler
tools.one_line_profile: Data generation framework for Structural Equation Models
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for defining Structural Equation Models (SEMs) and generating observational and interventional data samples. Useful for benchmarking causal inference algorithms and simulation studies.

tools.name: EnvCausal
tools.one_line_profile: Causal Inference Framework for Environmental Data Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A framework specifically designed for applying causal inference methods to environmental data analysis. It provides tools to analyze causal relationships in environmental datasets.

tools.name: CausalDynamics
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for structural discovery of dynamical causal models
tools.detailed_description: A large-scale benchmark suite designed for evaluating structural discovery algorithms in dynamical causal models, facilitating the comparison and development of causal inference methods.

tools.name: pscore_match
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for propensity score matching
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing propensity score matching (PSM) techniques to estimate causal effects from observational data by reducing selection bias.

tools.name: Causalinference
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for causal inference and econometric analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides tools for causal inference, including propensity score matching, weighting, and blocking, to estimate treatment effects in observational studies.

tools.name: CausalFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Unified framework for causality in time-series data
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to streamline causal discovery and inference in time-series data, integrating various methods for analyzing temporal causal relationships.

tools.name: F-PCMCI
tools.one_line_profile: Filtered PCMCI causal discovery algorithm
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the PCMCI causal discovery algorithm that incorporates feature selection methods to improve causal graph inference in time-series data.

tools.name: CausalFormer
tools.one_line_profile: Transformer-based model for temporal causal discovery
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of CausalFormer, an interpretable Transformer model designed to discover causal structures in temporal data.

tools.name: Proxy Causal Discovery
tools.one_line_profile: Causal discovery from subsampled time series with proxy variables
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a causal discovery method that handles subsampled time series data by utilizing proxy variables, enabling inference in incomplete temporal datasets.

tools.name: AmortizedCausalDiscovery
tools.one_line_profile: Amortized causal discovery from time-series data
tools.detailed_description: A framework for learning to infer causal graphs from time-series data using amortized inference, allowing for efficient causal discovery across multiple datasets.

tools.name: CausalNex
tools.one_line_profile: Library for causal reasoning and Bayesian Networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that helps data scientists to infer causation rather than observing correlation using Bayesian Networks, providing tools for structural learning and visualization.

tools.name: PySmatch
tools.one_line_profile: Propensity Score Matching (PSM) in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Propensity Score Matching (PSM) for observational studies, facilitating the estimation of causal effects by matching treated and control units.

tools.name: Nonlincausality
tools.one_line_profile: Nonlinear Granger causality testing library
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing Granger causality tests using nonlinear forecasting methods (like neural networks and random forests) to detect complex causal relationships.

tools.name: CausalInference.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference and structure learning in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for causal inference, graphical models, and structure learning, providing efficient implementations of PC and FCI algorithms.

tools.name: medoutcon
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient causal mediation analysis with natural and interventional effects
tools.detailed_description: An R package that implements efficient estimators for causal mediation analysis, specifically focusing on natural and interventional direct and indirect effects.

tools.name: medshift
tools.one_line_profile: Causal mediation analysis for stochastic interventions
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed for causal mediation analysis in the context of stochastic interventions, allowing for the estimation of effects under shifted treatment distributions.

tools.name: general-iv-models
tools.one_line_profile: Bounding causal effects in general instrumental variable models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for bounding causal effects in continuous, non-additive instrumental variable models, useful for causal inference where point identification is not possible.

tools.name: ngc
tools.one_line_profile: Estimation of graphical Granger causality
tools.detailed_description: An R package that implements methods for estimating graphical Granger causality, useful for analyzing time-series data and inferring causal networks.

tools.name: crumble
tools.one_line_profile: Targeted machine learning for causal mediation analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing general targeted machine learning methods for modern causal mediation analysis, handling complex data structures.

tools.name: v-cdn
tools.one_line_profile: Causal discovery in physical systems from videos
tools.detailed_description: A tool for discovering causal structures and physical laws directly from video data, applicable to modeling physical dynamics.

tools.name: causal-profiler
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic benchmark generator for causal machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for generating synthetic datasets to benchmark and profile causal machine learning algorithms.

tools.name: GrangerCausality
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB module for assessing causal links between time series
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB module designed to assess Granger causality between time series data, suitable for analyzing temporal dependencies in scientific data.

tools.name: lslx
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-confirmatory structural equation modeling via penalized likelihood
tools.detailed_description: An R package for structural equation modeling (SEM) that uses penalized likelihood for semi-confirmatory analysis, suitable for complex latent variable modeling.

tools.name: EconML
tools.one_line_profile: Automated learning and intelligence for causation and economics
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that applies machine learning techniques to estimate individual causal effects from observational or experimental data, combining econometrics and ML.

tools.name: causal-learn
tools.one_line_profile: Causal discovery algorithms in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for causal discovery that implements various algorithms (constraint-based, score-based) and independence tests to infer causal structures from data.

tools.name: causaltune
tools.one_line_profile: AutoML for causal inference
tools.detailed_description: A library for automatically selecting and tuning causal inference models (AutoML), optimizing the estimation of treatment effects.

tools.name: dodiscover
tools.one_line_profile: Global causal discovery algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing implementations of global causal discovery algorithms, part of the PyWhy ecosystem.

tools.name: DoWhy
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference library supporting explicit modeling of assumptions
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for causal inference that unifies causal graphical models and potential outcomes, enabling users to model assumptions, identify effects, estimate, and refute results.

tools.name: pywhy-graphs
tools.one_line_profile: Causal graph structures for the PyWhy ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A library providing NetworkX-compliant graph data structures specifically designed for causal inference and discovery tasks.

tools.name: pywhy-stats
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical functions and independence testing for causality
tools.detailed_description: A Python package containing statistical tools and conditional independence tests required for causal discovery and inference algorithms.

tools.name: pywhyllm
tools.one_line_profile: LLM integration for causal analysis
tools.detailed_description: An experimental library that integrates Large Language Models (LLMs) to support and enhance causal analysis workflows.

tools.name: CausalPy
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference in quasi-experimental settings
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing causal inference in quasi-experimental settings, often using Bayesian methods via PyMC.

tools.name: OneSampleMR
tools.one_line_profile: One-sample Mendelian randomization functions
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing functions for performing one-sample Mendelian randomization and instrumental variable analyses, used in genetic epidemiology.

tools.name: psmatching
tools.one_line_profile: Propensity score matching in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing propensity score matching, a statistical technique to estimate the effect of a treatment by accounting for covariates.

tools.name: causal-curve
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference for continuous treatments
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing causal inference with continuous treatments using observational data, implementing methods like GPS and TMLE.

tools.name: microbiotaPair
tools.one_line_profile: Simplified microbiome analysis workflows
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to simplify microbiome analysis workflows specifically for intervention studies, facilitating ecological and causal analysis in microbiology.

tools.name: bsem
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian structural equation modeling
tools.detailed_description: An R package for performing structural equation modeling (SEM) using Bayesian methods.

tools.name: causalLearning
tools.one_line_profile: Methods for heterogeneous treatment effect estimation
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing methods for heterogeneous treatment effect estimation, facilitating causal inference analysis in R.

tools.name: SRU_for_GCI
tools.one_line_profile: SRU-based time series generative models for nonlinear Granger causality
tools.detailed_description: Implements Statistical Recurrent Unit (SRU) based time series generative models specifically designed for detecting nonlinear Granger causality.

tools.name: Salesforce CausalAI
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and scalable framework for causal analysis of time series and tabular data
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source library for causal analysis, supporting both time series and tabular data with a focus on performance and scalability.

tools.name: HypEx
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and customizable framework for automatic causal inference
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed to automate and accelerate causal inference tasks, offering customizable pipelines for various causal estimation methods.

tools.name: seminr
tools.one_line_profile: Domain-specific language for building structural equation models in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing a natural domain-specific language to build and estimate structural equation models (SEM) using covariance-based or partial least squares methods.

tools.name: twowayfeweights
tools.one_line_profile: Estimates weights for two-way fixed effects regressions
tools.detailed_description: An R package that estimates weights and robustness measures for treatment effect heterogeneity in two-way fixed effects regressions.

tools.name: multilevelMatching
tools.one_line_profile: Propensity score matching for 3 or more treatments
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing propensity score matching and subclassification methods specifically for scenarios involving three or more treatment levels.

tools.name: semTools
tools.one_line_profile: Useful tools for structural equation modeling in R
tools.detailed_description: A collection of useful functions and tools to extend the capabilities of structural equation modeling packages in R, such as lavaan.

tools.name: simsem
tools.one_line_profile: Data simulation for structural equation modeling
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed for simulating data based on structural equation models, useful for power analysis and method evaluation.

tools.name: dcdi
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Causal Discovery from Interventional Data
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Differentiable Causal Discovery from Interventional Data (DCDI), a method for learning causal graphs.

tools.name: causal-llm-bfs
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Full Causal Graph Discovery Using Large Language Models
tools.detailed_description: A tool leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and Breadth-First Search (BFS) for efficient discovery of full causal graphs.

tools.name: umx
tools.one_line_profile: Quick and powerful Structural Equation Modeling in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package that simplifies and enhances Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) by providing a high-level interface to OpenMx.

tools.name: causal_impact
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference using Bayesian structural time-series models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for estimating the causal effect of a designed intervention on a time series using Bayesian structural time-series models.

tools.name: ddml
tools.one_line_profile: Double/Debiased Machine Learning in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing Double/Debiased Machine Learning (DDML) methods for causal inference and estimation of treatment effects.

tools.name: causalglm
tools.one_line_profile: Interpretable and model-robust causal inference using generalized linear models
tools.detailed_description: An R package for heterogeneous treatment effect estimation using generalized linear working models combined with targeted machine learning for robustness.

tools.name: tmle3mopttx
tools.one_line_profile: Targeted Learning for Optimal Individualized Treatment Intervention
tools.detailed_description: Part of the tlverse ecosystem, this R package focuses on targeted learning and variable importance for estimating the causal effect of optimal individualized treatment interventions.

tools.name: causalml
tools.one_line_profile: Uplift modeling and causal inference with machine learning algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides a suite of uplift modeling and causal inference methods using machine learning algorithms, suitable for large-scale data.

tools.name: causaldag
tools.one_line_profile: Creation, manipulation, and learning of Causal DAGs
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for creating, manipulating, and learning Causal Directed Acyclic Graphs (DAGs), supporting various causal discovery algorithms.

tools.name: tensorsem
tools.one_line_profile: Structural Equation Modeling using Torch
tools.detailed_description: An R package that implements Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) using the Torch deep learning framework, enabling GPU acceleration and automatic differentiation.

tools.name: CausalPFN
tools.one_line_profile: Amortized Causal Effect Estimation via In-Context Learning
tools.detailed_description: A tool for amortized causal effect estimation using Prior-Data Fitted Networks (PFNs) and in-context learning, enabling fast inference on new datasets.

tools.name: DiffAN
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion Models for Causal Discovery
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation leveraging diffusion models for causal discovery tasks, providing a novel approach to learning causal structures.

tools.name: DIA-toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for Distributional Impact Analysis and causal inference beyond average treatment effects
tools.detailed_description: A Stata toolkit developed by the World Bank for performing Distributional Impact Analysis (DIA). It provides methods to estimate impacts beyond the average treatment effect, allowing researchers to analyze treatment effects across different quantiles and subpopulations.

tools.name: GPSmatching
tools.one_line_profile: R package for matching on generalized propensity scores with continuous exposures
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed for estimating causal effects in observational studies with continuous exposures. It implements a framework for generalized propensity score (GPS) caliper matching, adjusting for confounding bias by matching on both estimated GPS and exposure levels.

tools.name: RealSeries
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive Python toolkit for time series analysis including causality and forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed for handling various time series tasks. It includes modules for Anomaly Detection, Granger Causality analysis, and Forecasting with uncertainty estimation, providing an out-of-the-box solution for time series datasets.

tools.name: AIPW
tools.one_line_profile: R package for Augmented Inverse Probability Weighted estimation of causal effects
tools.detailed_description: An R package that implements the Augmented Inverse Probability Weighted (AIPW) estimator for calculating average causal effects. It provides a robust method for causal inference by combining regression adjustment and inverse probability weighting.

tools.name: lavaan
tools.one_line_profile: R package for structural equation modeling (SEM)
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive R package for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM). It allows researchers to specify, estimate, and analyze latent variable models, including confirmatory factor analysis and path analysis, which are essential for causal modeling.
